For the question 'What is the purpose of the cabin in an airplane?', what is the correct answer among the choices crash, living, slow down, carry people speed up? Explain the cause-and-effect relationship between the question and your chosen answer.
rationale: 1. The correct answer is **(D) carry people**. The purpose of the cabin in an airplane is to provide a comfortable and safe space for the passengers and crew to travel in. The cabin is pressurized and ventilated to maintain a suitable environment for humans at high altitudes. The cabin also contains seats, windows, lights, lavatories, and other amenities for the convenience of the travelers. The cause-and-effect relationship is that the cabin is designed to serve the purpose of carrying people in an airplane.
